title: WOW!
content:
I had no choice but to watch that 3 times in a row... it's incredibly well animated, and the timing (not only on the mouth synching, but the anticipation/line of action/followthrough) is INCREDIBLE.

TMST, how long did you spend on this!? Did you get paid for it? This is absolutely amazing. There are no words for how awesome this is. I'm gonna show all my friends. Great work!

title: Re: WOW!
content:
I believe the answers are six weeks and something from ABS for (temporary?) exclusivity.

But indeed, this is easily one of the best animated Flashes ever made. I'm just waiting to see how he'll top himself next. ;p

title: Re: WOW!
content:
Woah, haven't seen this one yet either! As said above, it's just awesome! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] Incredible work!

"Did you get paid for it?"
I'd guess he did this just for fun, too. TMST's wacky imagination goes perfectly with the crazy Lemon Demon songs. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: holy shit
content:
I first saw this about a week ago, and have already lost count of how many times I've watched it :P. I just happened to be looking at the Lemon Demon article on Wikipedia for some reason, looked at the list of music videos, and hey what the hell, there's a new one, how'd I miss that? Turns out it had been released only hours before... very nice timing :P

The increase in quality since TMST's previous LD music videos is amazing. The higher framerate really makes a difference too, and I love the pseudo-3D stuff. Oh, and the Brains easter egg had me in stitches for a good minute or two [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] _________________

title: Re: re:
content:
What about the fact that this "dopefish" is spouting like a whale, not a fish? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
I decided to steer clear of blatant copyright infringement this time (except in the Bonus Footage). But I also wanted it to look slightly dopefishy.

[quote]Quote:[hr]"Did you get paid for it?"
I'd guess he did this just for fun, too. TMST's wacky imagination goes perfectly with the crazy Lemon Demon songs.
[hr][/quote]
Since last year I was always intending to make Bad Idea for Halloween 2006, but as it turned out, ABS did pay me some $$ to secure exclusivity for hosting the animation. My first (major) paid animation work! Woot! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]
Absolutely incredible. I particularly enjoyed the graveyard fight scene... animating a complex sequence like that so fluidly is quite a feat.
[hr][/quote]
That scene took the longest to do. Quite a few days.

[quote]Quote:[hr]
The song's stuck in my head now. TMST it's really good. I think you should keep working on it. Add more frames, more detail etc. It could be a really big hit, maybe even the best flash clip.
[hr][/quote]
I don't keep working on anything once it's released, unless it has mistakes in it that I neglected to fix. "Not enough cool FX" is not a good reason to keep altering something after it's out there. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] Let it go. It's already a hit, but that's not why I made it.
This animation marks exactly where I'm at now. Time to move on and show where I'm at with my next one, not stagnate in one spot making remakes over and over like a certain Mr Lucas...----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: re: sound
content: The audio component was entirely Lemon Demon's creation--any use of the DooM sound effects would have been their idea... TMST just did the video component, which is why, for example, the Chainsaw and Flamethrower don't make a noise, the main character doesn't scream when the zombies break through the "TMST" wall to grope him, and so on. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: re: sound
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]The audio component was entirely Lemon Demon's creation--any use of the DooM sound effects would have been their idea...[hr][/quote]

His idea, rather. Outside of live performances, Lemon Demon consists entirely of Neil Cicierega.

title: Scream!
content:
I assumed it was a guitar bit, that you incorporated INTO a scream, as part of your creative license. It doesn't sound like an actual human scream, to me, at any rate.

Edit: Okay, I found some more cameos / tidbits.

1) Was that a nod to Gauntlet, having the green portal which kept spawning zombies, in the "But they came in waves" sequence?

2) One of the zombies in the crowd chasing during the 2nd "Bad idea" refrain looks remniscent of Monster Bash's primary zombie, albeit thicker. Also, the bouncing head.

3) Colin Mochrie zombie in the line of flame-throw'ed zombies during the "Kick some zombie ass" sequence--he's 2nd to last.

There's just too much to love, here. I like the skeleton who had stabbed itself with the pitchfork, too. What's the importance of "IGSF2D," the license plate?

title: Re: Scream!
content: IGSF2D is an acronym for "I've Got Some Falling To Do" (the name of one of TmsT's previous animations - the animation from which the main character was borrowed - in case anyone didn't know).

title: Re: Scream!
content: Also, watch reeeeeeeally closely for a certain undead president.

title: Re: Scream!
content:
Those rotating shots are pretty impressive.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: Scream!
content:
1) What's Gauntlet? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] I just drew a crypt, and then I wanted some kind of "evil glow" to be coming from within it so that the black silhouettes of the emerging undead would show up against the crypt. For evil glows, I'd overused red a lot, so I tried green as a contrast, and it looked purdy. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-love.gif[/img]

2) I didn't put in any blatantly copyright-infringing visuals, so if there's a Monster Bash-like monster in there, it might be a coincidence. If you mean the little guy at the front, he was just meant to be a small, hyperactive zombie. I think I saved his Flash-object with the name "Shorty".
The bouncing head is from the 3rd zombie that attacks Guy in the "It began in slow motion" bit. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

3) Wow, you noticed it was Colin. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Or maybe that was from the tattoo. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

The skeleton on the side of the road is actually trying to pull the pitchfork OUT of himself - not that you can tell, really. But he does have another bony arm clamped in his jaws, so it obviously wasn't just a one-man fight. In my mind, a guy had had his arm bitten off by a zombie that he was soon in the process of pitchforking (before he himself "turned" and staggered off in search of juicy, warm brains). [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-halloween.gif[/img]

Don't forget to watch the HIDDEN bonus footage! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Cameos
content:
Gauntlet is that old arcade game with the "BLUE WIZARD NEEDS FOOD BADLY!" and such. Monsters were spawned out of doorways which had a green glow just like that--and would keep spawning until you actually shot and destroyed the doorway itself. So seeing a line of zombies pouring out of a green doorway reminded me of that. Even though "green doorway" is rather generic--I wasn't accusing, just curious.

The zombie I said reminded me of MB was more in the posture of his run--the larger fella behind the skeleton, in front of the cleaver-wielder. But having written that, I suppose the 'arms-dangled' thing is just generic zombie habit, isn't it. :P Either way, again--not accusing, just wondering.

Is there hidden footage beyond the "BRAINS" guy?

title: Re: Cameos
content:
No worries XkyR. The hunchback between the skeleton and the zombie chef doesn't remind me of Monster Bash as much as some of the other zombies do though. ^_^;

"The Zombie Chef" is actually a character from the zombie musical that I wrote & co-directed in 2004, [url=http://tmst.twu.net/rnd/notsd.htm]"Night of the Singing Dead"[/url]. It also featured an eggbeat-- ahh, look at the poster. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] You can see a silhouette of the zombie Chef on the left, too!

(Interesting that the two top threads in this section of the forums seem to be about paedophilia and necrophilia. <--- I'm joking. I know you only love animated zombies, not real-life corpses. Er, real-death corpses I mean.) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-goth.gif[/img] ----------
